subject: Negotiation
title: The Diffusion of Responsibility
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Diffusion of Responsibility.

hook.text: 38 people witnessed Kitty Genovese's attack. Nobody called police. Each assumed someone else would.

buildup.text: Diffusion of responsibility: the more people present, the less likely any single person will take action.

discovery.text: In group negotiations, responsibility must be assigned to specific individuals or nothing gets done.

twist.text: Saying 'someone should follow up' means nobody will. Saying 'Sarah will follow up by Friday' gets results.

climax.text: Assign every action item to a named person with a deadline. Diffusion disappears when ownership is clear.

punchline.text: If everybody owns it, nobody does. Name the owner.

quiz.question: How do you overcome diffusion of responsibility?
options: Add more people to the group
Assign specific tasks to named individuals with deadlines
